title: How tough guy Jamie Joseph replaced Eddie Jones as Japan's rugby mentor
text:
In the aftermath of Japan’s historic 28-21 victory against Scotland on Sunday night, Michael Leitch made a telling comment. The Japan captain was asked how his team had gone from rank outsiders to World Cup quarter-finalists over the past eight years. “The reason that this team has changed is because of Jamie Joseph in how he led us and how he taught us rugby.”

It was not quite ‘Eddie, who?’, yet the inference still led to a sharp intake of breath among several England beat journalists present. If the 34-32 victory over South Africa four years ago ranked as a Miracle of Brighton, launching its own feature film in the process, then what does reaching a first quarter-final equate to?
